The first letter 'alpha' in modern Alphabets

Originally read al'Pha, so not just 'a', but 'pha','fai'

This is reflected in the Futhark, the rune alphabet:

The Fe rune áš  (Old Norse fÃ©; Old English feoh) represents the f-sound in the Younger Futhark and Futhorc alphabets. It cognates to English fee, wealth, fee with the original meaning of Vieh : "sheep" or "cattle" (Dutch Vee, German Vieh, Latin pecum, Sanskrit pashu).
